comment: Professor Floyd is an amazing professor. I took her online COMM1100 class and it was pretty laid back and easy. She has weekly assignments but you only have to complete about 6 of them throughout the entire semester and the rest of them are dropped. You do have to read your textbook but it is not a hard read. There are only 2 tests which is a plus.

Talk about a boring class. You will fight sleep heavily in this class, it's so boring. The group activities suck too, they're not even fun. The lectures consist of just reading bullet points from a slide. I mean it's easy material, it's just so boring, I didn't even want to go. By the way, only go to class when there's group activities.

I had a technical difficulty during my final exam that was online outside of class, and she gave zero grace and I received a 0. I was originally three points away from a 100. I was ready for the final and she chose not to help.

Very pointless class. You don't learn anything from Floyd, so if you go to school to learn then you'll be disappointed. It's not an interesting study of human communication at all. It's remedial material, and while that might sound easy, Floyd often changes due dates and times without notifying people. No emails or in class discussions about it.

There is homework every week on each chapter that you'll need to read and take the quizzes, if they are late she will not accept them but they are due on Monday so you'll have plenty of time although there is a lot. Lectures are very involvement based, the more questions you ask and the more you participate the more you'll enjoy her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: It is an easy class, and she is very communicative with the class, but I also think that she can be selfish sometimes because she does not care what emergency you have, she would not give you a minute over the deadline. She is hilarious and interesting, but it is a lot of online reading that students have to do in pearson/revel.

love the subject, hate the professor. very slow class, I wanted to go to sleep every time I went. She's just reading her notes the entire lecture. Will not take anything late. The only reason why I gave her a 2 is because she gives out fresh eggs to whoever asks her. She only grades 2 tests everything else is assignments

She was an easy going professor, very nice but very textbook heavy. Everything was from the textbook, no point really in her class to me because everything you have to read yourself but you have to go to class because of participation activities that are very annoying. She makes is learn two chapters a once, confusing.

Professor Floyd is easy going. If you do your work on time, pay attention to her deadlines, you are going to do great! However, if you do NOT like lecture heavy classes, or classes that require attendance, do not take this class! Participation assignments once a week! She is very kind in person, but sometimes seems passive-aggressive over email.

She reads straight from the text book. Absolutely NO makeups. I once asked her to help me on an assignment and she said "what am I an elementary school teacher, no I am not helping." She seems to not care at all about students succeeding in her class. I am sure she is a good person outside of teaching but in the classroom, she needs to improve.

She accused the class of AI use when many of us got false positives. She brags about being tech-savvy, but can't answer our questions, nor does she know how this tech works. Some students who pass use AI to circumvent the detectors, meanwhile those of us who actually do the work get accused. Terrible communication skills and lack of empathy.

Please avoid this professor. Extremely AI paranoid won't do anything if you get a false positive from the detectors. Won't accept any proof and doesn't think false positives are real. Also gives out contradictory information and takes forever to respond to emails, which she barely reads. Doesn't answer questions and can be narcissistic.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Floyds COM 2033 class was very fun, and entertaining. Very easy class as long as you show up and actually pay attention to the material. A few quizzes online that are pretty easy, and a few projects that are easy, and fun. Highly recommend.

I enjoyed professor Floyd's class. The class is lecture heavy but the lectures are interesting and rely on class participation. Professor Floyd really enjoys class participation and encourages students to speak. Grades are 4 tests and 2 projects. First project is an Infographic and the second is a group project. Rubrics are clear. Pretty easy A.
she failed me on a project even though I followed the rubric EXACTLY, and it was 40% of our grade, and she basically said it was my fault. take someone else for this class.

Worst Professor Ive ever had. Accidentally told us all semester the final was optional only to tell us the day of that it was mandatory (with no extension) If you have any issues or questions you get a rude figure it out yourself response. Its like she wants you to fail. Avoid this Professor at all costs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: It was an online class, the lectures were from a different professor. Prof Floyd was a decent choice. The only irritating thing was that exams were only available on Sundays, which was unecessary. That may not have been her decision as she didnt design the course. But if you do the readings and watch the lectures you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: She is one of the worst online professors I've ever had. There is a very limited window for when tests are available, and she gives zero wiggle room for anything. She does not accept late work, she is inconsistent with due dates, and her tests require lockdown browser. Most professors will work with you and help you, but she will not at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: To be a communications professor, her presentation skills aren't the greatest. The class is super lecture heavy. She reads directly off the powerpoints to a point where she is dependent on them for class to function. Quizzes are weekly and open book, so make sure you get the textbook! She uses an attendance app but it was free to get.

She is a very understanding, easy-going teacher. There's never homework, just weekly quizzes and a few tests. The weekly quizzes are open book. Definitely lecture heavy, but she makes them fun and interesting and adds lots of videos in. She's very funny and sweet, definitely recommend taking her.

Professor Floyd read straight from the PowerPoints. She was visibly annoyed when anyone asked any questions. She requires an attendance app everyone has to PURCHASE in order to receive credit for attendance (which is 100 total points) I had to teach myself in order to pass the tests. Avoid this professor if you can help it.
She definitely had an attitude when confronted about being wrong on several things. Attendance is mandatory. Not a great experience
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Would not recomment. Dr. Floyd literally reads straight off the powerpoints and gets an attitude when asked questions. She gives a bunch of work, and you're better off just teaching yourself and learning from the textbook. She takes forever to grade work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY
